subsc: Central government administration,Ports, waterways and shipping

abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the Durres Port Project
            for Albania were as follows: the outcome was satisfactory,
            the sustainability was likely, the institutional development
            impact was substantial, and the Bank and borrower
            performance were both satisfactory. Lessons learned: the
            project succeeded in advancing the reform process even when
            major dated covenants were significantly delayed and
            monitoring targets were only partially achieved. The
            important international and domestic factors influencing the
            Government of Albania and the Port created forces within the
            transport sector that were not foreseen at the time of
            preparation. In projects with significant institutional
            development or restructuring objectives, supervision
            missions acquire reviewing and consulting responsibilities
            that go beyond the project components. The Bank should not
            allow its well-established practice of financing projects
            with sound feasibility studies to weaken.
